uk.ac.ebi.centres.graph

Class AbstractDigraph<A>

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.ebi.centres.graph.AbstractDigraph<A>
  • Type Parameters:
    A -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConnectionProvider<A>, Digraph<A>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConnectionTableDigraph

    public abstract class AbstractDigraph<A>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Digraph<A>, ConnectionProvider<A>
    A digraph with a single immutable root.
    Author:
    John May

    • Method Detail

      • getRoot

        public Ligand<A> getRoot()
        Description copied from interface: Digraph
        Access the root ligand of this digraph. The root is normally the chiral atom that is being determined. When determining ligands around double bond, two roots are normally needed. These two roots will provide each other as ligands and thus should be filtered out (currently outside of digraph).
        Specified by:
        getRoot in interface Digraph<A>
        Returns:
        the root ligand of the directed graph

      • getProximal

        public java.util.List<Ligand<A>> getProximal()
        Description copied from interface: Digraph
        Access the proximal ligands next to the root. If no root is set this method will throw an IllegalArgumentException.
        Specified by:
        getProximal in interface Digraph<A>
        Returns:
        list of proximal ligands
        See Also:
        Ligand

      • getLigands

        public java.util.List<Ligand<A>> getLigands(A atom)
        Description copied from interface: Digraph
        Access all created ligands for the provided atom. In acyclic structure with only single bonds there will only be a single ligand per atom. Cyclic structures and double bonds create 'ghost' ligands in the structure which can also be accessed. It is important to note that the method will only return ligands for atoms that have been built.

        As the digraph is normally constructed on a per-ligand basis an atom may have no ligands if they haven't been visited yet. This can be fixed by invoking Digraph.build().

        Specified by:
        getLigands in interface ConnectionProvider<A>
        Specified by:
        getLigands in interface Digraph<A>
        Parameters:
        atom - to access ligands for
        Returns:
        a list of ligands that have been constructed for the provided atom
        See Also:
        Digraph.build()

      • reroot

        public void reroot(Ligand<A> ligand)
        Description copied from interface: Digraph
        Reroot the digraph on the provided ligand. This does not recalculate the whole graph (each centre should have it's own graph) but instead transforms the directions of the the edges to point away from the new root. This method is primarily used for generating auxiliary descriptors.
        Specified by:
        reroot in interface ConnectionProvider<A>
        Specified by:
        reroot in interface Digraph<A>
        Parameters:
        ligand - the ligand which will be the new root

      • build

        public void build()
        Description copied from interface: Digraph
        Exhaustively expands from the root creating all ligands. Normally the graph is constructor on a per-ligand basis starting at the root. When using auxiliary descriptors expanding the whole graph is often required as centres need to be determined on remote regions.
        Specified by:
        build in interface ConnectionProvider<A>
        Specified by:
        build in interface Digraph<A>
        See Also:
        #getLigands(A)
